product_overview: The Bazaar is a Progressive Web App (PWA) marketplace designed to connect buyers with verified vendors, offering a comprehensive e-commerce platform with modern features such as user authentication, product management, shopping cart, order processing, and vendor management. It aims to provide a seamless, engaging, and secure shopping experience with advanced search, reviews, and payment integration.
core_goals: Enable secure and seamless user authentication and profile management for buyers and vendors.
Provide a rich product catalog supporting browsing, filtering, searching, and detailed product views including variants.
Implement efficient shopping cart functionality with easy add, remove, and update operations.
Support order creation, tracking, and management with integrated payment processing.
Empower vendors with profile management, registration, and dashboard functionality.
Enhance user engagement through reviews, wishlist, and notifications.
Deliver a progressive web app experience with offline support and install prompts.
Ensure intuitive navigation and responsive UI with reusable components and error handling.
key_features: User authentication including sign up, sign in, and sign out using Supabase Auth.
Product management with browsing, search, filters, detailed pages, and variant options.
Shopping cart capabilities with add, remove, and update item functionalities.
Wishlist feature allowing users to save and manage favorite products.
Order management system covering order creation, tracking, and history.
Checkout process integrated with secure payment solutions.
Vendor management including registration, profile pages, and dashboards.
Category browsing and filtering for easier product discovery.
Product reviews and rating system to foster community feedback.
User profile management with address, payment methods, and notification settings.
Robust search functionality for products and vendors.
Home page featuring dynamic carousels, featured products, and category highlights.
Full PWA support enabling offline functionality and install prompts.
Navigation components including an enhanced navbar and footer.
Error boundary components ensuring graceful error handling and protected routes for authenticated access.
Modular UI components built with Radix UI and Tailwind CSS for consistency and reusability.
Custom React hooks for data fetching, state management, and responsive behavior.
Static informational pages such as About, Contact, Terms, Privacy, and FAQs.
user_flow_summary: User visits the landing page and browses featured products and categories.
New users sign up or existing users sign in through the authentication pages.
Authenticated users browse products, use filters and search to find items.
Users view product details including variants and add desired products to the shopping cart.
Users manage their cart, update quantities, or remove items before proceeding to checkout.
During checkout, users provide payment details and complete the purchase securely.
Users can view order history and details via the Orders page.
Vendors register and manage their profiles and product listings via the Vendor Dashboard.
Users can add products to a wishlist for future reference and write reviews after purchase.
App supports offline use with cached data and prompts users to install the PWA on their devices.
Users customize profile settings such as address, payment methods, and notifications.
Navigation facilitates smooth transitions across marketplace, profile, orders, wishlist, and vendor areas with route protection ensuring security.
validation_criteria: Authentication workflows must securely allow users to register, login, and logout with proper error handling.
Product listing and search features must correctly filter and display products including variants.
Shopping cart must accurately reflect changes in item quantity and allow item removal.
Checkout must integrate payment processing with success and failure handling.
Vendor management tools must enable profile creation, editing, and dynamic routing for vendor profiles.
Reviews system must allow authenticated users to submit and view product reviews and ratings.
PWA features must support offline functionality and display install prompts appropriately.
UI components must be responsive, accessible, and consistent across different pages and devices.
Navigation should protect authenticated routes and provide clear user flow without dead ends or errors.
Error boundary components must capture and display errors gracefully without breaking the app.
Static pages must load correctly and display accurate information.
All forms and inputs must validate user data and provide actionable feedback.
